Class InventoryBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nsider.inventorymanager.inventory.InventoryBuilder

  • public class InventoryBuilder
extends Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InventoryBuilder(String inventoryName, int inventorySize)
      Constructs an InventoryBuilder with the specified name and size.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addItem(ItemData data)
      Adds an item to the inventory.
      void clear()
      Clears the inventory and the itemsMap

      Finds the ItemData with the specified name.

      Checks if the inventory has a base inventory
      void load()
      Clears the inventory and adds the items from the itemsMap to their respective slots.

      Opens the inventory for the specified player.
      void removeItem(ItemData data)
      Removes an item from the inventory.
      void save()
      Saves the inventory name and InventoryBuilder object to the InventoryHandler This method should be called right after you've finished adding all ItemData to the itemsMap(addItem) for that inventory.

      Updates an item with the updated data

      • InventoryBuilder

        public InventoryBuilder(String inventoryName,
                        int inventorySize)
        Constructs an InventoryBuilder with the specified name and size.
        Parameters:
        inventoryName - The name of the inventory.
        inventorySize - The size of the inventory.

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public void addItem(ItemData data)
        Adds an item to the inventory.
        Parameters:
        data - The ItemData containing information about the item to be added.

      • removeItem

        public void removeItem(ItemData data)
        Removes an item from the inventory.
        Parameters:
        data - The ItemData containing information about the item to be removed.

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves the inventory name and InventoryBuilder object to the InventoryHandler This method should be called right after you've finished adding all ItemData to the itemsMap(addItem) for that inventory.

      • hasBaseInventory

        public boolean hasBaseInventory()
        Checks if the inventory has a base inventory
        Returns:
        True if the inventory has a base inventory, false otherwise

      • load

        public void load()
        Clears the inventory and adds the items from the itemsMap to their respective slots. This method should be called before opening the inventory for a player.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the inventory and the itemsMap

      • getItemDataWithName

        public Optional<ItemData> getItemDataWithName(String targetName)
        Finds the ItemData with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        targetName - The name to look for in the data.
        Returns:
        The ItemData containing information about the item.

      • updateItem

        public void updateItem(ItemData data)
        Updates an item with the updated data
        Parameters:
        data - The ItemData containing information about the item

      • openInventory

        public void openInventory(org.bukkit.entity.Player p)
        Opens the inventory for the specified player.
        Parameters:
        p - The player to open the inventory for.
